<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 297, 393, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 368, 374]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 386, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 255, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 526, 765, 558]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 567, 760, 597]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 73, 124, 88]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 103, 640, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass unit \(1u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81\mathrm{ms}^{- 2}\)

<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Two dippers \(\mathsf{D}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{D}_{2}\) are used to produce identical waves on the surface of water, as illustrated in Fig. 6.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[299, 116, 693, 303]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 319, 591, 338]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 6.3 (not to scale)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 350, 541, 370]]<|/det|>
Point P is \(7.2 \text{cm}\) from \(\mathsf{D}_{1}\) and \(11.2 \text{cm}\) from \(\mathsf{D}_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 920, 418]]<|/det|>
The wavelength of the waves is \(1.6 \text{cm}\). The phase difference between the waves produced at \(\mathsf{D}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{D}_{2}\) is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 181, 448]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 428, 526, 448]]<|/det|>
State and explain what is observed at P.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 552, 181, 571]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 551, 920, 587]]<|/det|>
State and explain the effect on the answer to (c)(i) if the apparatus is changed so that, separately,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 599, 764, 618]]<|/det|>
1. the phase difference between the waves at \(\mathsf{D}_{1}\) and at \(\mathsf{D}_{2}\) is \(180^{\circ}\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 720, 836, 740]]<|/det|>
2. the intensity of the wave from \(\mathsf{D}_{1}\) is less than the intensity of that from \(\mathsf{D}_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 831, 920, 850]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[831, 861, 920, 880]]<|/det|>

A cell C of e.m.f. \(1.50 \text{V}\) and internal resistance \(0.200 \Omega\) is connected in series with resistors X and Y, as shown in Fig. 7.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 465, 571, 484]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 496, 920, 530]]<|/det|>
